A world without disease would have a significant impact on healthcare systems, leading to the closure of hospitals and medical facilities.
Without diseases, medical research would shift its focus to other areas, such as aging and longevity.
A disease-free world would have a significant impact on the economy, with people living longer and more productive lives.
Without diseases, society would have a different understanding of health and wellness, leading to a greater emphasis on preventative care and lifestyle choices.
The eradication of diseases would have a profound impact on human evolution, as genetic mutations that confer disease resistance would no longer be advantageous.
